title: Block subscription push not realtime
body:
I want to listen new block event realtime to do some thing. but erigon push event in group of 3. how do i configure? thx.

#### System information

Erigon version: docker thorax/erigon:2.55.1-arm64

OS & Version: Linux 6.2.0-1012-aws 22.04.1-Ubuntu SMP aarch64 aarch64 aarch64 GNU/Linux

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
```sh
erigon
  --chain="mainnet"
  --datadir="/data/erigon"
  --http.addr="0.0.0.0"
  --http.port="8545"
  --http.corsdomain="any"
  --http.vhosts="any"
  --http.api="eth,web3,net,trace"
  --rpc.gascap="500000000"
  --authrpc.addr="0.0.0.0"
  --authrpc.port="8551"
  --authrpc.jwtsecret="/data/erigon/jwt.hex"
  --authrpc.vhosts="any"
  --ws
  --maxpeers=10
```

Consensus Layer: docker sigp/lighthouse:v4.5.0-arm64-modern

Consensus Layer Command (with flags/config):
```sh
lighthouse
  beacon_node
  --network="mainnet"
  --datadir="/data/lighthouse/mainnet"
  --http
  --http-address="0.0.0.0"
  --http-port="5052"
  --http-allow-origin="*"
  --execution-endpoint="http://erigon:8551"
  --execution-timeout-multiplier="2"
  --execution-jwt="/data/erigon/jwt.hex"
  --checkpoint-sync-url="https://mainnet.checkpoint.sigp.io"
```
Chain/Network: mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
receive new block event push realtime

#### Actual behaviour
event pushed in group of 3, but geth and public rpc use same code behavior is right

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
nodejs use ethers@6 package
```mjs
import { WebSocketProvider } from 'ethers'

const provider = new WebSocketProvider("ws://127.0.0.1:8545")
provider.on('block', (block) => {
    console.log(block)
})
```
likely you have high-latency disk - and erigon can't keep-up on chain tip. show logs, share disk info.

@AskAlexSharov Thanks for your reply.

I select aws gp3 **3000 IOPS 256 throughput nvme ssd** disk. both erigon and lighthouse beacon data on same disk.

![image](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/assets/15168529/2bc4e65f-8d43-4f42-8c8b-e8504c58798a)
```sh
/dev/nvme1n1p1 ext4  3.1T  2.9T  230G  93% /home/ubuntu/data
```

erigon log, I delete `[4/12 Execution]` redundant log
```log

[INFO] [EngineBlockDownloader] Downloading PoS headers... height=unknown hash=0x5bbbad9ef0de3677504f427acb187e291f8f028749d2ebb66976a04a38df7533 requestId=0

[INFO] Beginning downloaded blocks insertion

```

Likely `gp3` has bad latency for Erigon2. 
Not enough logs.

I restart my erigon node and record video. Below is full log.
